STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 21, 2025
JILL SCHREUDER
CATHOLIC CHARITIES WEST MICHIGAN - BENTON HARBOR
185 E. MAIN STREET ST.102,
BENTON HARBOR, MI, 49022-4432
Re: License #: CB110403982
Dear JILL SCHREUDER:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
October 6 – October 10, 2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CB110403982
Licensee Group Organization: Catholic Charities West Michigan
Licensee Designee: JILL CHRISTINE SCHREUDER
Chief Administrator: JILL CHRISTINE SCHREUDER
Name of Agency: CATHOLIC CHARITIES WEST MICHIGAN -
BENTON HARBOR
Agency Address: 185 E. MAIN STREET ST.102
BENTON HARBOR, MI 49022-4432
Agency Telephone #: 2695931000
Original Issuance Date: 04/21/2020
Service Types: Certify foster homes for license, Evaluate
Applicants for adoption, Place children for
adoption, Place children in foster home,
Supervise Independent Living
1

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12209 Orientation and training
• (2) The orientation and training specified in subrule (1) of this rule for each
social service worker must include all the following topics:
• (a) Characteristics and needs of children and families served by the
agency, including trauma-informed parenting, human trafficking,
systemic racism, and SOGIE training.
Three of Eighteen employee files reviewed did not contain documentation of all
required training. The three files were all missing documented SOGIE training.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (a) Approval from the certifying agency authorizing the placement of a
child in the home.
One of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain documentation
of the certifying agency's permission to borrow the bed prior to the youth's
placement in the home.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
2

CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (c) The initial evaluation and current reevaluation.
Three of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain verification
that all evaluations were provided and reviewed prior to the placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (b) Verification that the foster parent is willing to accept the foster child.
Two of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain verification of
the foster parent's willingness to accept the youth prior to the youth's placement in
the home.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (d) A copy of all special evaluations completed during the last 2 years.
Three of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain verification
that all special evaluations completed within the last 2 years were provided and
reviewed prior to the placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (e) Verification of all children currently placed in the home.
3

Three of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain documentation
that verification of all children in the home was provided and reviewed prior to the
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (f) Documentation that the foster parent has received orientation to the
policies of the borrowing agency.
Three of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain documentation
that the family was provided with orientation to the agency policies and procedures
prior to the placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
• (1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another agency the
borrowing agency shall have a record containing all the following:
• (g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed by the foster
parent and the borrowing agency.
Three of Three Borrowed Foster Home files reviewed did not contain a signed copy
of the foster parent agency agreement signed prior to the placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following in the child's record before a
change of placement occurs:
• (f) Notification to the parents, referral source, lawyer guardian ad litem,
and courts when applicable, of the change in placement.
One of Six open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of all required notifications prior to placement changes.
4

REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection Report 9/13/23, CAP Approval 9/27/23
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following in the child's record before a
change of placement occurs:
• (g) Information about the child was shared with the new placement,
consistent with the requirements of R 400.12417.
One of Six open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of all required information being provided to caregiver before or at
the time of placement for two placement changes.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following in the child's record before a
change of placement occurs:
• (h) The child's new location and address.
One of Six open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of Medical Authorization being provided to the caregiver prior to or at
the time of placement for two placement changes.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following in the child's record before a
change of placement occurs:
• (j) Supervisory approval before the change.
One of Six open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of the current foster parent being provided with notification of their
rights concerning change in placement for two placement changes.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or parents and the foster
parents in the development of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the child and the parents' and
the foster parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-agency treatment plan with
5

the parent or parents and foster parents. The agency must inform the parent
or parents and foster parent that the information in the parent-agency
treatment plan and any other information about the child and the child's family
is confidential.
Five of Six open files of youth in foster care placements did not contain
documentation of the caregivers or parents being provided with a copy of all PATPs
and/or documentation of all PATPs being reviewed with the caregiver or parent.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child and parent
or parents, as follows:
• (a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
One of Nine open files of youth (6 foster care, 3 IL) contained one Initial Service
Plan completed late.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child and parent
or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at least once
every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of Nine open files of youth (6 foster care, 3 IL) contained one Updated Service
Plan completed late.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (3) When case responsibility changes from 1 child placing agency to another
child placing agency, a modified service plan must be completed within 30
calendar days of the change in agency responsibility if no other plan is done
within 30 days. The plan must address why the agency responsibility
changed and whether there are any modifications to existing service plans.
Three of Nine open files of youth (6 foster care, 3 IL) did not contain a modified
service plan completed within 30 days of case transfer addressing the reason for the
change and whether there were any modifications to existing service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
6

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (6) Service plans must be signed by the social services worker and the social
services supervisor.
Three of Nine open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not have
worker and supervisor signatures on all service plans/PATPs. Additionally, one of
the files contained reports signed by the supervisor utilizing the worker's name.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
Interim Inspection Report 9/13/23, CAP Approval 9/27/23
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following information:
• (g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of Nine open files of youth (6 foster care, 3 IL) did not contain a current photo
of the youth.
CPA Rule 400.12502 Program statement
• (2) An agency shall give a copy of the program statement to a youth before
placement in independent living.
Two of Three open files of independent living youth reviewed did not contain
documentation that the youth was given a copy of the agency's IL program
statement prior to/at placement in agency's IL program
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
• (3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living with a copy of the
agency's policies and procedures required by this rule.
Two of Three open files of youth living independently did not contain documentation
that the youth was given a copy of the agency's IL policies and procedures prior
to/at placement in agency's IL program.
7

REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
• (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
• (a) Face-to-face contact between the social service worker and the
youth in independent living at least once each month at a youth's place
of residence.
Two of Three open files of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of all monthly face to face visits with the youth at the youth's
residence. One file was missing a visit with the youth in June of 2025 and the other
documented all monthly visits were conducted with the youth outside of the shelter
in which he lived.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
• (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
• (b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is complying with the
terms of the required by R 400.12510, continues to reside in a safe
and acceptable environment, and is managing expenditures.
Two of Three open files of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of the youth's compliance with an independent living agreement and
verification of youth's ability to manage expenditures at monthly intervals.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
• (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
• (c) Provide the youth with a telephone number to contact the agency
on a 24-hour, 7-days-a-week basis.
8

Two of Three open files of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation that the youth was provided with number to contact 24/7 (would be in
policies/procedures).
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (1) There must be a mutual agreement between the youth and the agency
specifying all the following:
• (a) The responsibilities of the agency and the youth.
Two of Three open files of independent youth reviewed did not contain a mutually
agreed upon Independent Living agreement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by the youth and the social
service worker. The agreement must be reviewed with the youth at least once
every 90 calendar days and a copy provided to the youth.
Three of Three open files of independent youth reviewed did not contain a signed
and dated IL Agreement completed at least every 90 days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal Inspection Report 8/29/24, CAP Approval 9/19/2024
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (1) When an agency terminates its independent living services for a youth,
the agency shall document all the following information in the case record
within 30 calendar days of termination of its services:
• (c) A summary of the services provided during care and the needs that
remain to be met.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain summary of
services provided during care and needs that remain to be met (typically closing 69).
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
9

• (1) When an agency terminates its independent living services for a youth,
the agency shall document all the following information in the case record
within 30 calendar days of termination of its services:
• (d) Provision for any follow-up services.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of provisions for follow up services, if any (typically closing 69).
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who ends
independent living is provided with all the following:
• (a) Basic information about health, housing, counseling and mental
health services, and emergency resources.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of youth being provided with basic info about health, housing,
counseling, mental health and emergency services (typically closing 69).
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who ends
independent living is provided with all the following:
• (b) A birth certificate.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of youth being provided with a birth certificate within 30 days of case
closing (typically closing 69 or case contacts).
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who ends
independent living is provided with all the following:
• (c) A social security card.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of youth being provided with a social security card within 30 days of
case closing (typically closing 69 or case contacts).
10

CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
• (2) An agency shall ensure and document that each youth who ends
independent living is provided with all the following:
• (d) The youth's funds and personal property.
One of One closed file of independent youth reviewed did not contain
documentation of youth being provided with all funds and personal property within
30 days of case closing (typically closing 69 or case contacts).
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Review MiSACWIS job aides regarding family adoption assessment
routing and approval process.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding adding SOGIE training to orientation
and annual training checklists.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The first
CAP was submitted in response to the 2024 licensing renewal inspection dated
8/29/2024 and was approved on 9/19/2024. That CAP addressed 18 licensing rule
violations and 4 MDHHS policy violations no longer regulated by DCWL. Of the 18
licensing violations addressed, 12 were cited as repeat violations during this
inspection. Additionally, the number of overall violations increased this year from
22 to 31. It is noted the agency experienced a near complete turnover in staffing,
in part due to poor performance and practice by a number of staff, including the
agency program manager.
The second CAP was in response to special evaluation report 2025SIC0000544
dated 7/9/2025 and was approved 7/18/2025. That CAP addressed an employee's
11

failure to complete their job responsibilities and falsifying social work contacts. The
initial verification with CAP compliance was completed and the agency has
demonstrated compliance with each action step identified. Final verification of
compliance with the CAP will be completed in December.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report dated 9/25/2025 was reviewed and discussed
during the entrance meeting. The Chief Administrator indicated the significant
turnover in agency staff during the period under review has resulted in difficulty
maintaining overall compliance as the majority of staff hired have little to no
previous foster care experience. These staff are in the process of learning all
aspects of compliance related to their job responsibilities. Conversely, the agency
has hired a leadership team with many years of combined experience which the
Chief Administrator notes will lead to more stable and efficient foster care team.
Financial Overview
The agency's annual financial audit was reviewed for fiscal year 2024. No financial
concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed all reported there have been many staffing
changes which have led to adjustments in how work is being done. Primarily,
changes in leadership have also changed worker expectations, which has, at
times, caused frustration. Despite these challenges, the staff report feeling
supported by their current direct supervisors and upper management. They feel
they can rely on their supervisors and teammates to assist when needed and to
provide any answers while they are learning.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office is located in a building with other non-profit agency offices and
has access to an interior hallway as well as direct access to the outside. The office
is secured through locked doors at all entrances. The staff work area with space
and equipment to provide for foster care, licensing, and adoption service delivery
is located behind a second locked door, which is also where the files are securely
stored. Physical CHRI is stored in a locked cabinet next to a cross shredder within
the Program Manager's office.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
12

October 21, 2025
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
October 21, 2025
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
13
